com.hippikon.security
Class DefaultAuthorizationContext

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.AuthorizationContext
      com.hippikon.security.DefaultAuthorizationContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class DefaultAuthorizationContext
extends AuthorizationContext

The DefaultAuthorizationContext provides a default implementation of the AuthorizationContext interface. New instances should be created by the authorization subsystem upon a successful authentication. The authentication subsystem must therefore guarentee that the userGUID and accountID of the authenticated user is available to the authorization subsystem.

In distributed applications the information may be passed to a Mediator (ref: Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object Oriented Software) that is responsible for making the AuthorizationContext object available to a client application.

For example, in an HTTP web based application this information may be available on the HttpRequest header, and a subclass to examine the HttpRequest may be named HttpAuthorizationContext.

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:

Dale Churchett

Constructor Detail

DefaultAuthorizationContext

protected DefaultAuthorizationContext()
The default constructor required for subclassing

DefaultAuthorizationContext

public DefaultAuthorizationContext(java.lang.String accountID,
                                   java.lang.String productID,
                                   java.util.List subscriptions,
                                   java.lang.String userGUID,
                                   java.util.List userRoles)
                            throws IllegalAuthorizationException
Creates a new DefaultAuthorizationContext object post-successful authentication.

Subclasses could pull this information from a database, subsystem or HTTP Requst headers/cookies. All checking for valid authentication information must be performed in the constructor prior to any permissions checking.

Parameters:
accountID - the identifier of the account the user belongs to [mandatory]
productID - the identifier of the product or application being access [mandatory]
userGUID - the identifier of the authenticated user [mandatory]
userRoles - a List of String role names assigned to the user for the product being accessed. The user must have been assigned at least one role before they can be authorized to any resource
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if any mandatory fields are null, blank or invalid within the system, or no product subscriptions exist

DefaultAuthorizationContext

public DefaultAuthorizationContext(java.lang.String accountID,
                                   java.lang.String productID,
                                   java.util.List subscriptions,
                                   java.lang.String userGUID,
                                   java.util.List userRoles,
                                   java.util.List userGroups)
                            throws IllegalAuthorizationException
Creates a new DefaultAuthorizationContext object post-successful authentication.

Subclasses could pull this information from a database, subsystem or HTTP Requst headers/cookies. All checking for valid authentication information must be performed in the constructor prior to any permissions checking.

Parameters:
accountID - the identifier of the account the user belongs to [mandatory]
productID - the identifier of the product or application being access [mandatory]
userGUID - the identifier of the authenticated user [mandatory]
userRoles - a List of String role names assigned to the user for the product being accessed. The user must have been assigned at least one role before they can be authorized to any resource
userGroups - a List of String group names assigned to the user for the product being accessed. The user may or may not have been assigned to any groups.
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if any mandatory fields are null, blank or invalid within the system, or no product subscriptions exist

getProductID

public java.lang.String getProductID()
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Returns the identifier of the product being accessed by the user. The combination of the productID and the accountID is used to qualify roles that are product-specific.

Specified by:
getProductID in class AuthorizationContext
Returns:
the identifier of the product being accessed

getUserRoles

public java.util.List getUserRoles()
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Returns a List roles assigned to the authenticated user as Strings in the context of the product being accessed. Each product must defined at least one role that users may be assigned, plus application specific roles used by the business logic.

Specified by:
getUserRoles in class AuthorizationContext
Returns:
the list of roles assigned to the user in the context of the product being accessed.

setUserPrincipals

protected void setUserPrincipals(java.util.List principals)
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Sets the list of user principals determined by the Policy callbacks for each ProtectedResource being accessed.

Specified by:
setUserPrincipals in class AuthorizationContext
Parameters:
principals - a List of String objects representing the user principals determined by Policy classes mapped to ProtectedResource objects being accessed.

getPrincipals

protected java.util.List getPrincipals()
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Returns the list of all principals of a user determined through a combination of user roles, groups and associations with the ProtectedResources being accessed.

This method is not made public because there is no guarentee when this value will be set by the authorization framework.

Specified by:
getPrincipals in class AuthorizationContext

setResourcePath

protected void setResourcePath(java.util.List resources)
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Sets the list of ProtectedResource names being accessed within the AuthorizationContext. This method is provided to pass through the complete authorization context to policy implementations only.

It is not made public since the authorization framework does not guarentee when the resource path list will be set.

Specified by:
setResourcePath in class AuthorizationContext
Parameters:
resources - a List of String objects representing the hierachy of ProtectedResource objects being accessed. The Strings match the ProtectedResource.getResourceName() return values.

getResourcePath

public java.util.List getResourcePath()
Description copied from class: AuthorizationContext
Returns the List of names of each ProtectedResource being accessed by the client.

Specified by:
getResourcePath in class AuthorizationContext
Returns:
a List of String objects
